questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The Architecture Board is typically responsible and accountable for achieving all of the following goals except ___________

choices.B: approving the strategic business plans proposed by individual organization units within the enterprise
choices.E: providing the basis for all decision-making with regard to changes to the architecture
choices.D: identifying and approving components for reuse

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Responsibilities

The Architecture Board is typically made responsible, and accountable, for achieving some or all of the following goals:

consistency between sub-architectures
identifying reusable components
flexibility of enterprise architecture
to meet changing business needs
to leverage new technologies
enforcement of architecture compliance
improving the maturity level of architecture discipline within the organization
https://www.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf7-doc/arch/p4/board/ab.htm#:~:text=The%20Architecture%20Board%20is%20typically,flexibility%20of%20enterprise%20architecture

Selected Answer: B
B. approving the strategic business plans proposed by individual organization units within the enterprise

choices.D: To ensure that stakeholder concerns are being addressed by a project
choices.B: To review a project for compliance to external laws and regulations
choices.C: To review a project against established architecture criteria and business objectives
choices.A: To review the validity of a project's Architecture Vision

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Reference: Architecture compliance reviews ensure alignment with established architectural criteria, the "spirit" of the enterprise architecture, and the organization's business objectives. This process helps catch errors early, ensure best practices, and align projects with business needs.

Selected Answer: C
Architecture Compliance Reviews
An architecture compliance review is a scrutiny of the compliance of a specific project against established architectural criteria, spirit, and business objectives. A formal process for such reviews normally forms the core of an enterprise architecture compliance strategy.

https://www.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf7-doc/arch/p4/comp/comp.htm#:~:text=An%20architecture%20compliance%20review%20is,an%20enterprise%20architecture%20compliance%20strategy.

Selected Answer: C
architecture criteria and business objectives

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of an architecture compliance review?

choices.C: Apply the ADM with the specific vision to establish the practice
choices.A: Use the same approach as with any other capability
choices.B: Regard the establishment as an ongoing practice
choices.D: Treat the establishment as a one-off project

questions.question_text: TOGAF provides guidelines on how to use the ADM to establish an architecture capability. Which one of the following is NOT a correct guideline?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
46.1 Overview

This shouldn't be seen as a phase of an architecture project, or a one-off project, but rather as an ongoing practice that provides the context, environment, and resources to govern and enable architecture delivery to the organization

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap46.html

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is defined by TOGAF as: the fundamental organization of a system embodied in its components, their relationship to each other, and the principles guiding its design and evolution?
Complete the sentence. In TOGAF, architecture viewpoints represent ______

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Architecture viewpoints define abstractions on the set of models representing the Enterprise Architecture, each aimed at a particular type of stakeholder and addressing a particular set of concerns. Viewpoints can be used to view certain aspects in isolation, and to relate two or more aspects.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap14.html#:~:text=Architecture%20viewpoints%20define%20abstractions%20on,relate%20two%20or%20more%20aspects.
